title: Pineapple Cake Moonshine Recipe
description: Homemade pineapple cake moonshine is delicious and easy to make in an Instant Pot using ingredients like cake-flavored vodka, pineapple, and sugar.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Drinks Recipes Cocktail Recipes Vodka Drinks Recipes Pineapple Cake Moonshine 5.0 (1) 1 Review 2 Photos This easy Instant Pot pineapple cake moonshine recipe is smooth from the first night and will be sought out by your friends. While I’m not sure of its exact shelf life, I’ve stored it in my pantry for over three months — but it usually disappears long before then! Submitted by CRUNCHM Updated on March 12, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Additional Time: 40 mins Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 90 fluid ounces Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 5 cups water 1 (750 milliliter) bottle cake-flavored vodka 1 ½ pounds fresh pineapple spears 2 cups white sugar Directions Combine water, vodka, pineapple, and sugar in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as an Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to the manufacturer's instructions. Set timer for 30 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 40 minutes. Transfer pineapple to a blender; blend until smooth. Return pineapple to the pot; stir to combine. Pour moonshine into sterilized bottles. Store in a dark place. Chill before serving. Cook's Notes: Due to the alcohol content, keep your pressure cooker away from open flames. You must use the natural, not quick-release, method. name: CRUNCHM
instructions: Combine water, vodka, pineapple, and sugar in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as an Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to the manufacturer's instructions. Set timer for 30 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.;Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 40 minutes.;Transfer pineapple to a blender; blend until smooth. Return pineapple to the pot; stir to combine. Pour moonshine into sterilized bottles. Store in a dark place. Chill before serving.
